key_changes.purpose: Make 4-column grid responsive with 2 columns on extra-small screens
Make 3-column grid responsive with 1 column on xs, 2 on sm, and 3 on lg screens

file_insights.impact: Skeleton loading states now adapt to different screen sizes, improving mobile UX

patterns_discovered.description: Using MUI's responsive breakpoint syntax with object notation for gridTemplateColumns
patterns_discovered.benefit: Provides clean, declarative responsive design without media queries

patterns_discovered.description: Applying responsive grid layouts to skeleton loaders to match actual content layouts
patterns_discovered.benefit: Prevents layout shift and provides accurate loading state preview across all screen sizes

patterns_discovered.description: Using multiple breakpoints (xs, sm, md, lg) to progressively increase columns as screen size grows
patterns_discovered.benefit: Ensures optimal spacing and readability on mobile, tablet, and desktop devices

gotchas_discovered.gotcha: Skeleton grid breakpoints may need to match actual content grid breakpoints
gotchas_discovered.explanation: If the actual ProjectsPage content grids have different breakpoint values, skeleton loaders won't provide accurate loading state preview
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Should verify that the skeleton breakpoints match the breakpoints used in the actual rendered content grids

gotchas_discovered.explanation: xs (0px), sm (600px), md (900px), lg (1200px) - easy to confuse order and values
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Reference MUI documentation for exact breakpoint values when making responsive adjustments

approach_outcome.summary: Successfully updated ProjectsPage skeleton grids to be responsive using MUI's breakpoint system
details: Modified two skeleton grid layouts to use responsive gridTemplateColumns
First grid: Changed from fixed 4-column to 2-column on xs/sm screens and 4-column on md+ screens
Second grid: Changed from fixed 3-column to 1-column on xs, 2-column on sm, and 3-column on lg+ screens
Changes align with responsive design best practices for loading states

recommendations.recommendation: Verify that actual content grids use matching breakpoints
recommendations.rationale: Skeleton loaders should provide accurate visual preview of final layout to prevent layout shift

recommendations.recommendation: Test responsive design at key breakpoints: 320px (xs), 600px (sm), 900px (md), 1200px (lg)
recommendations.rationale: Ensure skeleton grids reflow correctly at MUI's defined breakpoints

recommendations.recommendation: Audit other pages for similar non-responsive skeleton grids
recommendations.rationale: This pattern should be applied consistently across all pages with skeleton loaders for uniform UX

recommendations.recommendation: Consider documenting the responsive breakpoint strategy used in ProjectsPage
recommendations.rationale: Helps maintain consistency when other developers work on responsive layouts
